strengths: Official docs explain SKILL.md structure clearly

keyPoints: Skills are model-invoked - Claude decides when to use them
SKILL.md is the only required file
Progressive disclosure: metadata (~100 tokens) → instructions (<5k) → resources (on-demand)
98% token reduction when skills are present but not used
Skills + MCP are complementary: MCP provides tools, Skills teach how to use them
Partner skills from Atlassian, Figma, Canva, Stripe, Notion, Zapier
Adopted by OpenCode, Cursor, Amp, Letta, goose, GitHub, VS Code

expertInsights: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines for optimal performance
Use trigger-rich descriptions - Claude uses semantic matching to decide when to apply skills
Use gerund form (verb + -ing) for Skill names
Claude Code 2.1 merged skills and slash commands - skills now appear in slash command menu
The context window is a public good - every token competes with conversation history

comparison.slashCommands: Manual trigger with /command, single markdown file, simple repeatable tasks
comparison.skills: Auto-invoked by Claude, directory with multiple files, complex autonomous capabilities
comparison.mcp: Protocol for external service connections, provides tools that skills teach how to use
comparison.subagents: Separate context window, runs as isolated worker, returns results to main agent

progressiveDisclosure.stage1: Metadata loading (~100 tokens) - Claude scans available Skills
progressiveDisclosure.stage2: Full instructions (<5k tokens) - loads when Claude determines Skill applies
progressiveDisclosure.stage3: Bundled resources - load only as needed
progressiveDisclosure.benefit: Can include 10+ skills but only pay for ones Claude activates
